website_summaries.verdict: Many settings and notable performance from this popular model that's manufactured by a top name in the industry.
pros: Sports a slim, contemporary design that's aesthetically appealing
Oscillates to circulate air well, even in larger rooms
cons: Reasonably quiet on low settings, but somewhat noisy on higher settings

website_summaries.verdict: Great for large spaces and constant streaming of clean, cool air.
pros: Keeps rooms up to 200 square feet cool all summer long
Customers find this device better than a ceiling fan
Multiple settings allow for customized cooling experiences

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a month now can’t use higher than second setting!!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this fan when first using it but now i hate it! It was not worth the money or hassle I went through getting it..... bought and received the first part of February and started using it mid April worked fine for first month Of occasional use but now I can’t use any higher than second setting or it makes a horrible loud noise!!! Ridiculous I bought it to replace a fan I had been using for almost 5 1/2 years running almost non stop that entire time! Yet this more expensive newer fan didn’t last a month! Like I said RIDICULOUS!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter HW

customer_reviews.title: Mine is not quiet at all
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and it makes a loud rattling noise on every level. It's most noticeable on the sleep setting and then again on the higher ones. I like the design and airflow but the noise is making me want to return it! I can hear it rattling in the next room with the door closed.
customer_reviews.author: casandra cain

customer_reviews.title: Generates a low frequency hum on wood floor.
customer_reviews.text: I have only one problem with this unit but if I can't find a work-around, I will be returning it. As the item description indicates, the unit is very quiet - as long as I suspend it and it does not come in contact with the wood floor. It generates a rather noticeable very low frequency hum when it sits on the floor. Placing the unit either on a rug, a small platform with rubber 'bumpers' on the underside, or two strips of wood does nothing to eliminate the vibration. I wonder if the base design is partially responsible.
customer_reviews.author: GFP

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, great setting options
customer_reviews.text: I love the settings on this fan. They aren't simply 1,2,3 and oscillate. It even has a timer if you want to fall asleep with a nice breeze. I like the white noise setting but all settings apart from the top power setting are very quiet. Even when I am six feet away sitting on my couch I can easily feel the breeze on a lower setting. Also the assembly takes maybe 3 minutes, it's super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kerra

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, but too weak to be worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Too weak, even on the highest setting. Makes zero temperature/airflow difference in our small bedroom. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Arc

customer_reviews.title: It would be fine for a very small room (10' x 10' or ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as scheduled and installation took less than 5 minutes. The problem is the very weak air stream that the fan produces. Even at maximum velocity/power, it is not nearly enough to reach beyond 10 feet or so. It would be fine for a very small room (10' x 10' or smaller). Not suitable for a medium or large room or even a hallway. It is quiet, but that's probably the result of its lack of power. Honeywell should not advertise this for use in medium or large rooms. I'm not a picky person and generally give positive reviews. Just can't do that here.
customer_reviews.author: BillSD

customer_reviews.title: Not a good high speed fan. Works like a normal cheap fan.
customer_reviews.text: There’s really no point for it to 8 speeds. Each individual speed is a VERY small minimal change that is not very noticeable. It works just as good as a normal cheap fan on high speed, only difference is, it’s quieter. Was hoping for more wind power with less noise... definitely should’ve went with the Lasko high velocity tower fan. Just didn’t want to pay $75 for a fan, now looks like I’ll be paying $75 on top of the price of this fan... Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice fan, poor option for bedroom
customer_reviews.text: This is an attractive fan, with a nice sound. Unfortunately Honeywell made a brain dead decision for using it in a bedroom. The dimming feature doesn't save the last setting. In fact every time you press any button it resets to maximum brightness. And the remote doesn't have a button for dimming on it. So you adjust it from bed and now it's full bright again.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: 2 years ago I bought a previous version of this fan and it is still excellent. Since this model was no longer available I bought this one with the full expectation that it would be similar. I wanted it for my small bedroom and needed to turn it on during the night to cool down. The light comes on and it cannot be turned off on the remote meaning you have to get up to turn it off. But the worst was the very strong chemical smell that it emitted every time I turned it on. I even let it run outside for several hours to no avail. After 2 weeks I gave up and returned it. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Robinson

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT CRAPPED OUT
customer_reviews.text: I used this fan for a couple months, a couple hours a night while sleeping. It started rattling then shut off, now will not turn back on. Seems to have happened about a month after the return/support policy expired. Thanks Honeywell!
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie patti

customer_reviews.title: Randomly turns on and off?
customer_reviews.text: Honeywell HYF290B Quietset Black is randomly turning on and off and performing different settings on it's own with no input from me. I have to unplug to keep it from turning on while I'm sleeping. If I plug it back in, it will turn itself on randomly sometimes 30 minutes later. Either I'm missing something or I must've received a bad unit. If the fan didn't do this, I think it would be a great fan for the money. It is quiet and has a nice compliment of settings. The remote doesn't come with the 2 AAA batteries required. I think the more frustrating part is that I've had to return several items purchased from Amazon lately.
customer_reviews.author: campbell

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't last 2 months before it quit working. I purchased the product insurance (Which was a waste when I thought about it). I did a continuity test before and after replacing the fuse, confirming the issue was internal. I was referred to the manufacturer and they were polite. Took them 7 days to have UPS generate a return label. I guess I should have kept the box, but I didn't. You definitely get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Not quiet - hums, drones, and speed fluctuates
customer_reviews.text: I got this fan to replace an older Lasko tower fan that was beginning to get noisy. I specifically was looking for something quiet that moves enough air for my master bedroom (17×19) This fan makes some of the most irritating little noises. The motor hum is deep toned and drones just loud enough to give me a headache. The most frustrating thing is how the fan speed fluctuates a little in every single setting. It's just noticable enough to drive me crazy. I made it through one restless night trying to see if it was bearable... but I'm returning it today.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Ullrich

customer_reviews.title: Not a lot of power
customer_reviews.text: We have a bedroom that is very warm and our tower fan wasn’t proving much relief. After reading the reviews of this fan we were excited to purchase and finally have some cold air that it promises. But at the highest setting it actually has less power than the cheap one we had been using from Walmart. Pretty disappointed. The “power cool” setting is misleading to say the least. We know it isn’t an air conditioner but hoped for a great fan. Will be returning. But it is super quiet. That’s a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Raqy

customer_reviews.title: Want one for every room
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, good amount of air while staying quiet. Even on the highest setting the noise level is pretty low. I love this fan, its perfect for my livingroom.
customer_reviews.author: Zowie

customer_reviews.title: This fan is bad at all the extra features, but it has a good range of cooling settings.
customer_reviews.text: If you need a tower fan with a range of settings, this is a nice quiet one. If you're looking for a fan to run at night, I would look elsewhere. The fan has a bright light that comes on every time you touch a button. You can dim or darken the light altogether, but next time you adjust the fan, maybe to turn on oscillation, the light comes back at full brightness. That makes the remote almost useless since I consider the value to be the ability to adjust the fan without getting out of bed. I still have to get up and fiddle with the brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Holm

customer_reviews.title: Weak fan!
customer_reviews.text: After so many good reviews, I was excited to get this fan for the hot California heat. The only positives is that is was very easy to assemble and quiet. However, the fan's air flow is so weak! On the highest mode I have to be 2 feet in front of the fan to feel anything. This was a giant waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Already broke after a week! No Air Coming Out!
customer_reviews.text: Had this fan for only 3 days and used it during the night only. Went to use it on the 4th day and it already stopped working, air won't even come out of it. Asked for a replacement one and should be here in a few days, will change my review if it actually lasts longer than a few days
customer_reviews.author: Natasha123214

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing & horrible sound
customer_reviews.text: Horrible sounding fan!!! After reading multiple reviews and having owned many fans; we were excited to get this one. Unfortunately it’s horrible sounding, it just doesn’t sound like it runs smoothly at all. It’s just unfortunate because the other reviews were positive. The fan noise goes up and down on its own, it makes a humming noise, and almost sounds like a faint alarm at times.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY found a Whisper quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: For years I've been search for a fan that is quiet. FINALLY I found one and will probably order another for elsewhere in the house. I can't even hear this one on the lowest setting. The sleep mode gives just the right amount of air movement. There are about 10 setting for the amount of air movement you want. The only odd thing is that the remote doesn't have the timer on it. You have to set the timer on the fan itself. All the other settings are on the remote. It doesn't come with batteries in the remote, so be prepared to buy some.
customer_reviews.author: Debby S

customer_reviews.title: Windy
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I put this in my gaming room which seemed to always just have heavy stagnant air ripe with the smell of fresh farts. Well, no more! This baby circulates the air and whirls away the stench of last night's tacos like a breeze. It's fairly quiet on the modes that are supposed to be quiet and not horribly loud either on the faster settings. The remote works well and the timer is something i didn't know i needed. This is my first tower fan and it exceeded expectations for this jabroni.
customer_reviews.author: SurferBud1

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS FAN! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tower fan. It oscillates, has multiple speeds, has a remote control and it has a sleep function. This thing is freaking awesome and worth the $$$. It keeps the room cool with a good breeze, it’s pretty quiet and I like the faint noise of a fan in the background too. I bought this wonderful how long it would last and if it would hold up to my standards or even decent recommendation standards. Surpassed both by far! Get yourself one, it has been a great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Brent Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Like having a cicada in your room
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan because I wanted a slim profile unit for my bedroom with more than 3 speeds. What I wasn't expecting was the noise. On all but the very lowest settings, this fan has a high-pitched whine - and regardless of setting, the fan's motor constantly surges and then slows, so there's no consistency in the sound. (Kind of like having one of those crazy summer cicada bugs right in your room.) My husband complained it kept him awake the first night we used it, and by the second night we'd both had enough. Returning, and going back to using our cheaper and quieter hardware store fan.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No irritating fan noise!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first tower fan I had ever had that did not make a fan noise. I bought a Lasko tower fan and it was horrible the fan noise was so irritating I had to return it back to Bed Bath & Beyond. Then I bought a Vornado fan- did not care for the design - Did not give the airflow in the right direction. This Honeywell tower fan sounds smooth and flowing and not irritating. It is extremely easy to operate. I wish it had more airflow but it is still very effective and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: LMT

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in the hopes that I could turn the AC back and just use this fan in our bedroom. Well that is not going to work. It seems to be as powerful as my ceiling fan, but it just circulates warm air. And probably the worst thing of all, it is so dang loud! Not to mention the bright light on the top of the unit. Seriously considering returning for a refund, as I think there are better options out there. Probably better buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Case

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this fan. It has a great range of speeds and is fairly quiet for the amount of air it moves. Unfortunately there is a rattle coming from the timer button when the fan is on the lowest setting. The rattle stops if you touch the timer button. I'm guessing the fan blades aren't well balanced and it's causing a vibration which resonates with the button when running at certain speeds. I'll probably keep the fan if I can find a way to mitigate the rattle.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Broken base upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: I received this and the base would not function properly. I had ordered one previously and had no issues assembling it. When I called I was given the run around by the Honeywell company. Amazons solution was to send a new one and I had to return the broken one myself. Closest Amazon return center is no where around my home. So displeased. I would avoid this company simply for their no-help-at-all policy if something is incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice replacement for the old fan
customer_reviews.text: The wife needs a constant flow of air on her at all times seated in her chair lest she spontaneously combust. Her prior fan was a squat round type that not only lacked a remote, but the switch was in an awkward spot. So she resorted to a small radio remote control receiver which was iffy during usage in real life. My son was extolling the virtues of this model fan so we bought her one. So far she loves everything about it. The remote works well, the sound is tolerable and the breeze provided is first rate. She hasn't caught fire, or even glowed a bright red since getting this fan.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Williams Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good air, generally quiet, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good airflow, love the remote, and usually quiet. The sleep timer is super useful for cooling off while you're trying to fall asleep but not drying out overnight. However, under certain conditions it generates incredibly annoying, pulsating low frequency vibrations at the lowest 2-3 speed settings. I haven't figured out what's causing it, and it seems to depend on the placement of the fan relative to walls and furniture and where I am in the room, and it even changes depending whether I am standing or sitting. Must be generating some kind of standing wave. Turning the speed up stops the low frequency vibes but the air noise gets a little louder.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wilson

customer_reviews.title: just ok
customer_reviews.text: This Fan has a light so bright it lights up my whole bedroom. I need to remember to put some electrical tape over it because I really like a dark room. The light gets brighter the higher up in power you want the fan. I'm in Phoenix AZ and today it was 115. I want that fan on full power...there fore I have a very bright light. Honestly on Full power even I feel this fan doesn't put out as much breeze as a different fan I had ordered off Amazon. This one is smaller and slimmer. Personally I would NOT order this fan again for other rooms in this house.
customer_reviews.author: Mys

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware: Doesn't play well with other remotes (seemingly).
customer_reviews.text: So I was having problems with this fan when I first got it and set it up. I initially loved it, but I noticed that it kept shutting off randomly, and then waking up randomly with different settings. I hunted online for an answer, to no avail, but I started noticing a pattern between the odd behavior, and my use of my TV remote. I moved the fan, played around with my TV, and haven't seen any issues since, fixed? Maybe? I hope?
customer_reviews.author: bclaymier

customer_reviews.title: Broke 40 days after using
customer_reviews.text: I had heard Honeywell was a great brand and needed a replacement for my fan unit which I had used for 10 years before. The fan itself was very quiet but not as quite as powerful as I was expecting. After 40 days, the fan motor decided to die on me because the lights are still working but the fan won't turn at all. Really disappointed because even worse that the return/exchange policy only goes for 30 days so I'm SOL of $70. I won't make the mistake of buying this brand again
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Speir

customer_reviews.title: A piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: This fan is a piece of crap...first of all the bottom housing didnt snap together so easily as instructions says it would, it didnt come with a remote and i had to tape together the bottom to pieces in order for the top fan part to have something to sit in...what a complete waste of money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Never again

customer_reviews.title: Not a cooling fan. For a tower fan this lacks power.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the fan for a little over three months and it stopped working.. every once in awhile I get surges of high-speed and then it shuts off. When I first turn the fan, the the speed or surge is higher. It quickly looses power, when I adjust it to a higher level it actually decreases the fan power.
customer_reviews.author: Cityslicker

customer_reviews.title: Great design, works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband while he's overseas. He doesn't have control of the temperature in his apartment, so it was too warm and muggy for him to get a good night's sleep! I bought this and had it sent to him, and he says it's a life saver! The remote makes it easy to quickly change settings if he wakes up in the middle of the night and needs to adjust anything. He also really likes that it oscillates and moves the air in the room really efficiently. The design of this fan doesn't take up too much space, and isn't prone to tip over. Overall, VERY HAPPY with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing all around.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not pleased with this fan at all. The different levels are nice, but that’s about the only good thing I can say. It’s not even been 2 months and the lower levels are making a horrible vibrating noise. Definitely not a nice background noise. The remote is complete junk. I have to really mash the buttons for them to work, and sometimes the power button will change the fan speed! And it starts rotating without me doing anything! Or half the time they won’t do anything. If this was within the return time it’d be going back. Unfortunately I’m stuck with it for now.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa K.

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy - Terrible Fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan is garbage. Assembly alone I wanted to send it back. It doesn’t cool the room or barely even BLOW AIR. Fanning yourself with a piece of paper would have more of an impact over this garbage fan. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Buys

customer_reviews.title: Quite Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: This quiet fan is exactly what I was looking for! My husband is very sensitive to noise during the night and, to him, our old fan sounded like a jet engine! Even at the highest level, the Honeywell is a background hum and not disturbing at all. I have not activated the remote control or sleep mode... I just set it and forget it. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: OrArt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This fan is AWESOME. I'm a HUGE fan, fan... is that a thing? Fan of fans? Anyway. I always have trouble finding a good fan. I recently moved into a new house, and needed a fan for my new office. I like airflow. I had ceiling fans in my office at my old house, none at the new house. Well this thing does the job. And man is it quiet. It has 8 different fan speeds, which they give unique names... like sleep, calm, cool, etc... basically just fan speed settings. It's really quiet on the lower settings yet has a great breeze still. This is a winner for me, as far as fans go
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan - Good Cooling
customer_reviews.text: I now have four of these fans. I bought two in July 2017, and they are still running fine. But I added two more this year for additional coverage. The fans provide a gentle cooling breeze when run on the lower setting and are very quiet. Our home also has four good ceiling fans. So all combined we can stay pretty cool even on days in the upper 90’s with just the fans. We live in central California where it is pretty hot all summer. The remotes work well although we don’t really find a need for them, as the fan top controls are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Best Life

customer_reviews.title: Garbage plastic nonsense, avoid at all cost
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, one started to make noise within two months, so that was a warning of another customer I should have heeded to. Second fan is making noise and unusable now after little over a year. The reason for this is simple, it is all plastic and it is all constructed in such a way that you can just as well burn your money instead of spending on this pipe dream.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: WOW !!!
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the negative reviews and was a bit worried. I ordered the 2 pack. One in black and the other in white. I have to say I am happy with my purchase. They are quiet and it does seem to keep the room cool. I use it along with my AC and it definitely helps circulate the air. I have a portable AC in my living due to casement windows. Adding one of the fans to help move the cool air makes a big difference. I normally do not feel the AC in the kitchen but now I do. The other one I put in my bedroom and I can feel the difference there too. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Kang

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: This fan works really well. Even on the highest setting it’s not disturbing at all. In our apartment, the central AC does not circulate at all from downstairs to upstairs (cheap construction) so this fan next to our open bedroom window works wonders. It was easy to assemble (two pieces for the bottom base, just make sure you place the cord correctly) and then two AAA batteries (not included) for the remote. Easy peasy. I don’t use the sleep mode, just leave it on all night. Worth the investment, took some time to get here but I’m thankful it’s here now.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Remote controller did not come.
customer_reviews.text: Edited: It turned out to be, the customer service information posted by the seller is incorrect. I called and emailed via the contact, but I got the response that the seller abuse the incorrect customer service information. And of course, they are not responsible for the product I purchased. I'm really not happy about it. The product is good. Light and relatively quite. However, it didn't come with the remote controller.... The back of the fan where the controller is supposed to be in is left empty.. I searched in the product box multiple times, but it wasn't there... The product itself is good, but the fact that I don't have a remote controller is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jkim

customer_reviews.title: Defective equipment ! Fan has NO power that’s why it’s QUIET!
customer_reviews.text: The product could not cool off room, remote control did not work. I called the company to see if i could get a replacement due to the fact that when you put the batteries in the remote, the remote would heat up and the batteries would become hot in seconds; the customer service rep stated we no longer have remotes for that unit.which tells me the company was aware of the defect. Due to an emergency out of my control i had to go out of town so the 30 day return i miissed so now I’m stuck with this garbage. DO NOT BUY THIS PRoduct!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: W.C. N

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: I really like these fans. They aren't too noisy. The price was great. There is different settings depending on how much cooling you want. They oscillate or can be still. I bought 2; 1 for our bedroom and 1 for our living room. They are powerful and definitely keep you cool. We've had ours for 2 years and they hold up. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: KatyLeigh

customer_reviews.title: Turns on/off on its own
customer_reviews.text: If you can get past the "ghost in the room" effect of your fan randomly turning itself on and off, this is a great fan. Its pretty quiet and pushes a decent amount of air for its size. Unfortunately, I'm not fond of my fan having a mind of its own, so this haunted device only gets one star. I've looked through other consumers' reviews on other sites and it appears I'm not the only one who has encountered this issue. Honeywell, hire an exorcist at your manufacturing facility.
customer_reviews.author: John Gerbac

customer_reviews.title: Great little air mover and quiet
customer_reviews.text: It was so hot in my apartment this summer as well as noisy from nearby construction, I purchased this air tower to address both issues and I was not disappointed. It is well made and a credit to the old Honeywell name. It was a snap, no pun intended, to assemble. I look the positioning of all the buttons that are easy to read at that angle (you won't have to lean down). It moves the air well at almost all settings. The upper range does impact my suburb hearing at night, so I keep it low at night to sleep and high during the day. I recommend it highly. Thank you Honeywell. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Videobarbs

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Effective Cooling
customer_reviews.text: Quiet and effective cooling keeps my AC from overworking itself. I keep this fan in my hallway to circulate cool air through my home instead of a single room and it is very effective. It is much quieter than traditional oscillating fans, and saves space while offering the same if not better functionality. I'm very glad I made this purchase and I would absolutely buy it again or as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Rushton-Southers

customer_reviews.title: Not Cool
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could return it but I threw the box away. I bought this for my sons room which is small but it doesn’t cool the room. The power is minimal. I thought it would blow fast enough to be able to feel a cool breeze but I’m disappointed. The features are ok and it looks nice. Now I have to spend more money for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Lakya Roberts

customer_reviews.title: this fan is taller than 32"
customer_reviews.text: This fan has a small footprint. We don't find it particularly noisy as some reviewers have suggested. But we did purchase it based on the description of a 32" height. This fan, on its base, is well over 32". It measures more like 41". And it has to be mounted on its base. Despite this we like the fan and are keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Acaman

customer_reviews.title: Just what i was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: The fan works great at helping me keep my room cool! It does make some noise when its on HIGH or POWER COOL, but its a fan come on! If i have my tv on it drowns out the noise from the fan. However i have noticed for some reason my tv remote interferes with the fan. If i adjust the volume on my tv it turns the fan off. The automatic timer shutoff is convenient because my son sleeps with me and when i leave for work he is still sleeping so i can set the timer to go off when the wife gets him up to go.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Company backs up their product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it almost immediately stopped working. I called the company many months later (mostly because I was busy and didn’t get around to it) they asked me to perform one test to see what the problem was. I did and they said it was a factory issue and promptly replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen mckillip

customer_reviews.title: Love having a remote it’s quiet and 8 settings.
customer_reviews.text: Only draw back is can’t seem to use timer from remote which is stupid but other than that it’s basically the same fan I had for years past and when it broke(my fault trying to clean it I broke several fins inside) I didn’t hesitate to buy this again. Good price, lots of settings, quiet, only draw back is there still isn’t an easy way to clean these things. Wish they’d put screws on them so could take the front and back off to dust. I’ll figure something out different then the last time. But I run this 24/7 thru the summer and my old one lasted for years hope this one does too.
customer_reviews.author: Keeran

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this fan was useless so I returned it. I thought buying Honeywell would make the difference but not so. The fan had to be blowing on me from about 2 feet away and forget oscillating because there wasn't enough force to cool anything. I did find that expecting any fan to cool hot air was unreasonable, for that you need an air conditioner but have found another brand that moves the air better.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: The best investment made this summer!
customer_reviews.text: Spending so much time at home now, my electricity bill came out almost double the usual amount this summer. So I decided to go for a fan instead of a/c and I am in love with this product. The best part for me is the sleep mode. It has a timer for 1, 2, 4, and 8 hrs, which works fine for me. I have it on all night on Whisper or Calm. It's quiet, as advertised. The best investment this summer. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great Fan for our Family room
customer_reviews.text: This tower fan is in a corner where it provides coverage to all points with its 90 degrees of oscillation. It is reasonably quiet at the highest air rate and very quiet otherwise. We may increase our TV's noise level when operating at its high end; however, this requires only a modest increase. The operation is quite simple from the remote or on the tower's control pad. There is off/on, oscillation or not, and air rate. I'd recommend this fan.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Just so disappointed !!! broken in months
customer_reviews.text: within 2 months, it's now making a wobbling noise!!! I bought the fan to use at night because of all the speed settings and wanted the tall air distribution.. What junk!!!! Does anyone make quality any more? This was far from the cheapest one. I made sure to buy the one in the middle...!!! can't tell you how disappointed I am. Now I deal with another one? And have wasted my money!!!!! DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: rob barrett

customer_reviews.title: Started great, but now the motor is loud
customer_reviews.text: This fan was excellent for moving cooler air into a room that needed it, but now the motor has become noisy and makes a whining sound while running. Almost sounds like a distant machine running at full speed? Hard to explain but it’s just not something you can sleep with. Otherwise it would be a 5 star review. The remote works great.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Wimberly

customer_reviews.title: Great fan features
customer_reviews.text: Takes up very little space in the room yet moves the air really well. A vertical line of air movement makes the old circle fans look very outdated and poorly designed. Don't expect noiseless operation, but it's a quiet fan. Features like sleep, numerous different power levels, and a remote make this a feature rich fan that has more features than what you'd expect at this price point. Helps keep my office cool and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: At first the fan was great. Everything worked and it put out enough air for our needs. After 2 month of use it just stopped pushing air. The fan still oscillated and all the buttons worked....no air being pushed though. The reason for the one star review is the customer service for this product....it is not there. I called three numbers provided by Amazon and each one was a dead end and when I thought I finally got through....the recording told me they were closed at 3pm in the afternoon on a week day. Not good, not acceptable. I would go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I received this fan five days ago and it worked fine. Today when I went to switch it on it no longer works. I contacted the products customer support but have not heard anything back yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fits our needs and is affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this. No blades so don't have to worry about little fingers getting injured, assembly was easier that making mac n cheese and the noise level is very low. It's not "silent" but it's not loud either, just the sound of air particles moving. Keeps the room cool enough, I mean it's not an air conditioner so it meets my expectation of what a fan should do. Price is great, just ordered another for additional room so I don't have to move it around. Light and doesn't take up much floor space at all. Definitely recommend this, especially if you have little children and just want to cool down a room.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Full priced repurposed defective product
customer_reviews.text: I received this fan today and noticed the box had been retaped. Upon further observation, noticed an extra piece of packing material with nothing in it and both of the bases sitting loose in the box. When putting together, I noticed on of the four clips was broken as identified in the picture. What makes me mad is Amazon is charging full price for a repurposed product with broken parts. This justifies the one star.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a small/ medium room size
customer_reviews.text: Fan is ok for a medium / small room. I placed my fan in living room and you can barely feel the air blowing, you would probably have to stand 5’ feet away from it., noise , quality of fan is good. Remote is useless., really all you need to do is set it on auto timer and forget about it.,
customer_reviews.author: vic

customer_reviews.title: Fan is possessed
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a few weeks, but then it started having a mind of its own. It would turn itself on and off and then change its own settings while it’s on. Never used the remote since it didn’t come with batteries. Even covering the sensor to block infrared detection doesn’t stop it. Don’t waste your money on this. You’ll end up returning it soon enough.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: A quiet fan perfect for the bedroom.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this fan to replace our Seville Classic UltraSlimLine that stopped oscillating (kids broke it). Initial thoughts are, nice build quality, easy to assemble, and good amount of air flow for how quiet it is. Compared to the Seville, it is more quiet even at the highest levels, however it doesn't feel as powerful. It moves air enough, but in our large living room it felt under powered. We have since moved it to our master bedroom and on the 2nd level, it provides good amount of gentle air flow with a whisper.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, multiple settings, easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, efficient fan for the price. I like the multiple settings available and that it’s simple to operate. It was easy to assemble, only took a few minutes. I live in the Southwest where it’s hot. My air conditioning went out, so I ordered this fan to help cool the house until the AC part comes in. It is cooling the room very nicely and can be easily moved from room to room.
customer_reviews.author: Shirl W

customer_reviews.title: Only good for background noise... doesn’t bring in any air
customer_reviews.text: This fan is great if you just need some background noise to sleep with. It does not suction in any air. I bought this too put near a window for these hot summer days, but it does not pull in any air. I didn’t want to buy a box fan because they are an eye sore, but I would rather have that than this fan. It is a pretty fan though, so if you just want a light breeze and background noise, this is perfect for you.
customer_reviews.author: josie

customer_reviews.title: Works well in a still room
customer_reviews.text: Pros-Quiet in a calm room, distributes air efficiently, and sleek design Cons-Oscillate mode makes some cracking noise & if there is any other kind of air movement such as a ceiling fan or open windows, this fan will randomly slow down & speed up making a ton of noise in the process. I’m not sure if there is an air regulator sensor causing this issue but it’s irritating when you want to have the windows open with the fan running simultaneously.
customer_reviews.author: B.Sullwold

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad i ordered this not other brands
customer_reviews.text: Before I ordered this fan, I was considering a lot because we were on a budget. Read a lot of reviews on at 5 different products/brands, I decided to try with this. First, it does not make much noise like other floor shop fan does. Secondly, it help cooling the room down. Not sure if it makes cool air as claim but my husband says it is ok. We live in New England and summer time it's too hot at night but this fan is good enough to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and convenient, quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: I paid a little more for the black one because it is more unobtrusive. It is a little strange to assemble, but the instructions aren't bad. Once you figure it out, it is a very sturdy fan. It has a mode wherein it cycles side to side, which I like. It does not move a huge amount of air, but it provides a pleasant breeze, which meets my needs. I am pleased with the product and the purchase from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: RJMAN

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money, get something similar.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Decent cooling but rattled like nothing you’ve heard before. Mine was missing the controller but it’s summer in Florida and I needed a fan at my house, immediately. I finally tossed it in the garbage can where it belongs. Get literally any other similar product because this is trash. I’ll just sweat until I get something that doesn’t want to off myself.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Stew

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice tower fan. This was my first purchase of this style of fan and I was not certain what to expect. The fan is very quiet and provides great airflow without taking up a a lot of floor space. It was extremely simple to assemble and I like the convenient slot on the back to hold the remote control. I would definitely purchase a second one when needed. If there is anything that could be improved, I would say it is the fixed height. I wish it had a height adjustment option for the tower. Overall, great fan that does the job very quietly!
customer_reviews.author: ladygrace

customer_reviews.title: Not quiet
customer_reviews.text: Can't use the oscillate function. Horrible sound produced by the motor. Fan itself is quiet. Blue light on fan buttons can be turned off, but comes on and stays on every time you touch a button on it. You then have to find the tiny little button which turns off the light (isn't it up) and click it 5 times. Super annoying. This product is trying to hard. I wish I'd bought a $20 pole fan from the dollar store.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey H.

customer_reviews.title: Good fan, quiet or loud - you pick
customer_reviews.text: I like that this fan has noise level selections (which coincide with fan speed). This way, guests in the guest room can pick their level of noise. We also tried it outside on the patio to move air and keep flies away. It doesn't throw air like an industrial fan, so don't expect it to go 40 feet. It does keep the flies away without drying out my eyes, so it's good in that way. The assembly is easy for anyone. And the tower stand helps the air movement get up a little higher than ground level.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Very cool air, quiet, or loud, however you like it!
customer_reviews.text: I am a white noise person, and I looove a ceiling fan but my husband does not. I dont know why I didn't buy one of these years ago. It's perfect, I can adjust to how cold I want to be and put directly point at me, and he's happy too! Blows surprisingly cold air and I usually only go up to the 4th setting. Haven't tried to the sleep mode.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Best fan Ever
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this fan. I have purchased three of them. To address the hum on my wood floor in the bedroom I put the unit on a towel. That did the trick. I especially like that you can shut off the display lighting. I have no longer sleep with my air conditioning at night. This unit very effectively cools the bedroom on hot nights. It does not take up alot of space so I purchased one for my kitchen, and one as a dorm gift. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: SAT

customer_reviews.title: King of all fans
customer_reviews.text: Bless your living space with this fan. It’s everything you could ever need in a fan. The low setting is actually low for when you don’t want to be freezing in 10 minutes, and there’s a perfect setting for any temp with 8 speeds. The remote is a little sluggish, I have to hit the buttons hard and sometimes hold them down for a minute, but ultimately it does what I tell it. Only downside is that there isn’t a sleep button on the remote, only the unit itself. I sleep with it on all night as I tend to get hotter overnight though so it’s not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Phob

customer_reviews.title: Lovely fan that thinks it's my tv
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful oscillating fan, that's relatively quiet and gets confused by my LG tv remote. Changing channels or hitting enter on the tv remote will lower or stop the fan's functioning. I don't need the remote control option since I'd rather just keep it running. I called the support line in the manual and they said it was a known problem with no way to turn off the remote control abilities. It's annoying, but we like the fan enough we just get up to turn it back on when we're settled on our tv program.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Hegna

customer_reviews.title: A giant piece of plastic garbage
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Looks like it will move some air but it’s not very good for anything beyond a small bedroom. I had it for two months then a little piece of the rotor inside broke off, when it did it broke more off, and made the thing unbalanced so it shook violently and fell over. More have fallen off since and now it can’t even do anything but waste electricity. Spend more for something better or do your research to find something better in the same price range.
customer_reviews.author: Package Man

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, gentle air movement.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to transmits a hum through the base of the unit to the hardwood floor causing a loud droning sound to be heard. Resolved by putting the fan on top of a towel. I have both the 5 speed and 8 speed fans. The 8 has two much lower settings that I'm not sure how to use yet, but will see. It's quiet, but not silent. You can hear it, but it won't disturb on the low settings. Only had for a few hours, but working great so far, but I think the 5 speed has more value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: James Battaglia

customer_reviews.title: Turns off by itself
customer_reviews.text: This fan turns off by itself. At first I thought I had accidentally turned on the timer button, but it wasn't. We have only used it three times. We have to completely unplug the fan to get it to turn back on.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT PUMP AS STRONG AS YOUD THINK
customer_reviews.text: On the HIGHEST mode ( mind you there’s 8 so imagine the lowest ) it still feels like a light breeze. Does not blow air as hard as I thought it would based on the reviews. Overall it’s nice sleek look is a plus. I will continue to use for next few days to see if I can deal. If not I’ll definitely be requesting refund due to the high price for this low blowing fan.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Either this is defective or honeywell sucks
customer_reviews.text: I only got this because everyone had no issue with it in their reviews when i turn this thing on the highest setting i can only feel a slight breeze i have never been so disgusted in my entire life... this fan is misleading on amazon. It doesn’t even cool down my room in this hot hot summer. I would ask for a return but i know the shipping charge would be like $30 so whatever. Thanks for making me waste my money Honeywell
customer_reviews.author: Nick martinez

customer_reviews.title: Completely exceeded my somewhat low expectations
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think i could get a quality fan on this website, but this fan is fabulous. It has saved me from having to run my AC on many nights and it is quiet enough to fall asleep to. I also thought the remote was silly, but I LOVE it. I don’t have to leave my bed if I get too cold. 10/10 highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lidia Riehman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bedside fan but has a short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: **update** the fan is about 11 months old now and has started clicking and the motor is loud like it is struggling. Motor is louder than the fan noises on the lower settings. Original review- I’ve had this about a week, even the lowest setting moves a lot of air. It is quiet and doesn’t take up very much space. Only complaint is the light settings, why do I need 5 dimming options before I get to turn the lights off and then if you push any buttons afterwards it jumps back to the brightest setting again! So really only one dumb complaint, this fan is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kali W

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great fan tower .. i come from laskos blade fans (round ones) but i consider a tower this time because of my 2 year old. No blades great air and really quiet even for the high speed. The remote is simple 3 bottons, i do recommend a mesh in the back that way it would be easy to clean im just worried about the stand, looks kinda not strong but overall its great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Coronado

customer_reviews.title: Short-lived product
customer_reviews.text: I used this fan only during really hot days, no more than 5 times. Then I put it in storage because I was preparing to move. Wanted to use it yesterday for the first time after pulling from storage and it doesn't power on. Tried both the power switch on the remote and the unit itself. Plugged into different wall plugs. Warranty ended while it was in storage so there's no recourse. Product failure after such minimal use is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Henson

customer_reviews.title: The light ruins it!
customer_reviews.text: The product works well and looks good. Unfortunately, there's no button for the light on the remote so if you turn it on during the night, you have to get up to turn off the light on the fan. Same if you change the speed after you've already turned off it's light.
customer_reviews.author: JSmith

customer_reviews.title: A great fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Honeywell HYF290B Quietset 8-Speed Whole-Room Tower Fan for use in my room over the garage. It is easy to operate, I leave the fan on the Power Cool setting, it is quiet, especially compared to the fan I previously used. I like the capability that the fan swivels. I highly recommend this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K Nemie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I love this fan! We just moved into an apartment and the AC is only in the living room/dining room area. We got this fan for our bedroom and it works perfectly during the day for the hot SoCal weather, as well as at night to keep us cool on those warm nights. It is not loud at all and we love the range of fan speeds available. It was easy to assemble as well. We've been using it for almost a month now on a nightly basis. Definitely would recommend this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Kenmuir

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: The high power mode is a joke. But since it’s a quiet fan, it can come in handy. We live in Phoenix and this fan with our A/C would not keep us cool thru the summer (and we need more fans). Would not recommend this fan if your goal is to really cool down a room.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan to cool off my bedroom. Sad to say it doesn’t put out the air like it said it would. I have it sitting on my nightstand to feel the air. For the price I paid I could have bought 2 fans... On the other hand as far as the noise level to me it’s awesome cause when on high it drowns out all other noise 👍🏻... helps me to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Cason

customer_reviews.title: OK fan, not as powerful as described, not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This fan isn’t nearly as powerful as the description made it sound. Definitely not enough to cool down a bedroom. I end up using this fan plus another fan to make it cool enough for me to comfortably sleep (and I have central air). I’ve had it 3 weeks and after about 1 week it already started making a weird noise. My favorite feature is being able to turn the light on the buttons completely off as someone who hates sleeping with any light whatsoever and the remote control is nice too. Just was expecting more for the price. Back to a box fan I go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: effective and dark
customer_reviews.text: The fan is just quite enough to provide some nice white noise. The fan power effectively provides provides cooling and when the oscillating function is used, distributes air nicely through our very large bedroom. My favorite part is being able to turn off the light, however. I only wish I could turn it off from the remote, since the fan is some distance from the bed when I like to use the remote to turn it on in the middle of the night. Still, I used to have to tape or tie a scarf over light on my fan, so this is much improved. I haven't used the sleep mode yet.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Powerful, Haunted?
customer_reviews.text: Great fan, remote works great, good amount of power, significantly quieter than my old fan and tons of options for speed. Mine is quite a free spirit, it turns off, turns on, turns ocsilate on or off, all just randomly. Not all the time, but often enough to notice. Hopefully a neighbor in an apartment around mine just has a very strong remote with the same frequency... I say goodnight to the fan just in case it's trying to kill me.. it has worked so far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 Lasko Tower fans, which I've had for years. I decided to add a 4th tower fan to my collection and decided to try the Honeywell one. It's definitely quiet, so are my Lasko Towers, but it is NOT as powerful as my Lasko Towers. It's also thinner than my Lasko Towers, but I'd rather have the power. The Honeywell will serve a purpose, but won't be at the top of my list for power in provided the air and circulation that I'm used to.
customer_reviews.author: fpkovers

customer_reviews.title: Fan is quiet but doesn't blow strong airflow
customer_reviews.text: I have the unit in a 10 X 10 remove. Order the unit because the morning sun of Florida hit this room window for several high temp hours. I like that the unit is quiet but thought the fan would provide a better gust of air to maintain a cooler feel in the room. The setting on high feels more like an air flow on normal fan rate. Unit offered multiple setting but I really couldn't tell the different within several settings. A bit disappointing. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Raquel P.

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, if you don't need one to cool the entire room.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these fans, one for my office and one for my child's room. These are not big rooms and we can place the fan right next to us to keep us cool. In this respect, it does just fine, and it is pretty quiet as well. If you are looking for a fan to completely cool a room, even a small one, this doesn't seem like what you are looking for. However, if you can be within a few feet of the fan and want something relatively quiet, then this is the fan for you.
customer_reviews.author: CMB

product_meta.title: Honeywell QuietSet Whole Room Tower Fan-Black, HYF290B
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Pattern Name:SinglePowerful, quiet, whole room cooling. Eight levels of quiet control, from "white noise" to "whisper." features digital temperature display, adjustable thermostat, oscillation, remote control and breeze mode. 12 Hour auto shut off timer. Reach through carrying handle. Refer to the user manual for troubleshooting steps.
feature_bullets: 8 speed tower fan: the Honeywell 8 speed tower fan exudes the feel of a spring breeze throughout your home;featuring quiet set technology that allows users to control their sound and cooling options, making it the perfect year round fan for any home

Quiet cooling: The slim modern design of this quiet & powerful fan features oscillating motion for whole room cooling; It features 8 speed touch button controls and comes with a remote control that nests in the back of the fan housing for easy storage

Honeywell fans: The right fan helps cool you off & improves airflow in your room or home; Give your air conditioner & wallet a break by using fans to help reduce your energy consumption & costs; Honeywell carries a variety of fans to meet your home needs
Honeywell quality: Help improve air circulation & energy savings in your home, bedroom or office with Honeywell fans;Fused safety plug

Increase your comfort: Using fans for air circulation in your home can help Increase your comfort, and help reduce energy costs as well; Honeywell carries a range of tower fans, floor fans, and oscillating fans find one for every room in the house

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars8,165 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Honeywell QuietSet Whole Room Tower Fan - Black, HYF290B
